original: Jacobsson, Nils Mauritz Valdemar, fd. lektor, Linköping, f. 21/7/73 i Malmö av ’trafikchefen Oscar J. o. Selma Lundberg. G. 08 m. Elin Björck. Barn: Ingmar f. 09. — Mogiex. i Gävle 91, teol. fil. ex. i Upps. 92, dim:-ex. 94, prakt. teol. prov 03, teol. lic. o. prästv. 04, provår v. norra real i Sthlm 05, disp. f. lektorskomp. 08, teol. dr 21. Stud:res. t. Tyskl. 03 o. 22. Tim-lär. v. Fjellstedtska sk. i Upps. 98-99, e. lär. i Norrtälje 04, lär. v. Palmgr. samsk. 05-06, Lyceum f. fl. i Sthlm 05, Beskowska sk. där 05-09, Sofi Alm-quists sk. 06-07, vik. lektor 08-09, lektor i kristend :kunsk. v. Linköp. h. a. 1. 09-38. Fäng:pred. 11-18. Led. av Linköp. domkap. 09-40, kyrkorådet 11, kretsomb. i fattigv. 12, kyrkovärd, ordf. i Solkl. vänner 30-47 o. Linköp. kyrkobrödrakår, sekr. i stiftets und::-stödsfÖTen. o. stA^r. f. Präst, änkehem. Skr.: Den sv. herrnhutism. uppkomist (08), Svenskar o. indian’er (22), Per Lindes,trömis res. t. Nya Sv:e lf653’-56 (231), Sv. öden v. Delawere 16318-18311 (38). red. f. stiftets julbok 10-12 o. 25-45. LNO, PatrstGM.
translated: Jacobsson, Nils Mauritz Valdemar, former lecturer, from Linköping. Born on July 21, 1873 in Malmö, to 'traffic manager Oscar J. and Selma Lundberg. Married in 1908 to Elin Björck. Children: Ingmar born in 1909. Mogiex in Gävle in 1891, obtained a bachelor's degree in theology in Uppsala in 1892, completed a teaching degree in 1894, passed the practical theology exam in 1903, obtained a theology degree and was ordained as a priest in 1904. During the year 1905, he went on study trips to Germany twice. He worked as an hourly teacher at Fjellstedtska school in Uppsala from 1898-99, as a teacher in Norrtälje in 1904, as a teacher at Palmgren's school from 1905-06, at the Lyceum in Stockholm in 1905, at Beskowska school from 1905-09, was a substitute lecturer from 1908-09, and was a lecturer in Christian studies at Linköping high school from 1909-38. He was the prison preacher from 1911-18 and a member of the Linköping cathedral chapter from 1909-1940, the church council in 1911, the circle delegate in poverty relief in 1912, churchwarden, chairman of the Friends of Solkl. from 1930-47, and Linköping's church brotherhood, secretary of the diocese's welfare and board of directors for the clergy and widows' home. Author of "The Swedish Herrnhutism. Origin"(1908), "Swedes and Indians" (1922), "Per Lindstrom's Journey to New Sweden 1653-56" (1931), "Swedish fortunes of Delaware 1638-1831" (1938). Also edited for the diocesan Christmas book from 1910-12 and from 1925-45. LNO, PatrstGM.
